result.execSummary:
The defendant Soua Nmi Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The Def is to obtain and maintain full time employment or enroll in a course of education or a combination of both.
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers including family or locations where drugs are used or stored including vehicles.
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the defendant can ask for expungment under 973.015.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

timeConds.notes:
Balance to be served on EM.

records.addlTxt:
From: JSS Re: is your intention to stay the 60 day sentence until investigation is over?
TWB: I think he absconded & DA should seek to notify him that he is to return to finish his sentence or sit in jail.
Filed in 14CF517

From: DOC Re: charge has max of 1 year probation
TWB: amend JOC to change probation to 12 months
JS Sentence Violation - ORDER TO DETAIN SIGNED BY TWB (Capias issued & filed in 14CF517)

3:23 pm Def in court w/ Atty Russell Edward Hammer.  Def in custody.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed - signed/understands.
14CF-517  Count 1 - Possession of Meth as a Repeater (Fel)  961.41(3g)(g) and 939.50(3)(i)  GUILTY.   Counts 2 & 3 dismissed but read-in.
14CF-802  Count 2 - Possession of Drug Para as a Repeater (Misd)  961.573(1) and 939.50(1)(a)  GUILTY.  Counts 1 & 3 dismissed but read-in.
Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  Rights/elements/questions gone over.  No promises/threats.  No firearms or voting and possible deportation advised.  Mr. Vang states what happened on those dates.
COURT finds the pleas are F, V & I made.  Sufficient factual basis.  Found guilty and convicted.
Hynek recommends 2 years probation and jail time on em.  He was revoked from probation previously...  This is definately an addiction issue.  Hammer has the same response to Mr. Vang as the last time he was in court...  Ashley Furniture wants him back so he has a lot going for him if he can kick the habit...  He's worried about his employment and is apologizing...  Asks for expungement on the felony.  Hynek obj. to expungement.  That would not benefit the public.  Vang comments.  Court comments.
SENTENCE withheld on each count
2 years probation on each count concurrent
AODA and comply with any recommendations
No alcohol or controlled substances w/o Rx from a Dr.
Random testing
Any other evals or assessments up to the agent
No contact with any known drug users or dealers including family
Not be at any location where drugs are used or stored including
Seek and maintain employment or schooling
Def. can come back and ask for expungement if probation is successfully completed
90 days CJ w/ 30 days credit - the balance of 60 days can be served on em
CC and DOC fees

Appeal rights advised

11:13 State by Emily Hynek, Def pres in custody, w/Atty Russell Hammer  -  Waiver of prelim hrg filed - Def has signed.  Court finds probable cause - boundover for trial - Information filed - Def stants mute - Not guilty.  Set for Status  2-19-15 @ 10.  Hammer Stmt re: bond - requests lower cash.  Hynek comments.  COURT:  CASH BOND REMAIN AT THIS TIME.
Review hearing on January 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bond required to remain
PH: 12-26-14 at 11:00am w/EML

Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination filed
$3000.00 Cash Bond required covers (14CF517 & 14CF802) with conditions:
No Contact with Kong X.
No controlled substances w/out a valid prescription
Comply with JS conditions - testing and GPS
